page.title: 07IMPACT OF LORD OF MANOR
page.content: This small part of England is still so dominated by the local manor that there is a great deal of feeling and opinion related to very local issues. The Forthampton Court has always been an important integral part of the life of the people and this is changing only very slowly. Apart from owning most of the land and many of the houses, the Yorke family were responsible for the church and even the routes taken by some of the roads. They also built the current working men's club (there is no public house in the village). It is probably this hold by the Yorke's which has helped to prevent the area being destroyed by new developments such as housing estates. It has also had an effect on local employment.
